Package Enginegames

Class Utils

java.lang.Object
Enginegames.Utils
public class Utils
extends java.lang.Object
A utility class capable of loading images, extracting assets from a compressed jar etc.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static java.lang.String assets
    The location of the (eventually extracted) assets folder
    static java.lang.String localAppdata
    The location of the appdata folder, dependent on the OS one is running
    static java.util.jar.JarFile me
    The Jar loaded from, when loaded in a jar null if loaded from a folder structure

  • Method Details

    • loadImage

      public static AdvancedImage loadImage​(java.lang.String filelocation)
      loads an image from anywhere on your pc. if no extention is given, .png is added automaticly note: this works in both, in folder as well as in jar structures. this also works with folders in folders.
      Parameters:
      filelocation - the location of the image
      Returns:
      the loaded image. !!may be null if no image was found!!

    • loadImageFromAssets

      public static AdvancedImage loadImageFromAssets​(java.lang.String filename)
      loads an image from the assets folder, located at the src root.
      Parameters:
      filename - name of the image
      Returns:
      the loaded image !!may be null if no image was found!!

    • getStringDimensions

      public static int[] getStringDimensions​(java.awt.Font font, java.lang.String text)
      returns the dimension of the given string.
      Parameters:
      font - the font of the text
      text - the text itself
      Returns:
      the dimension of the string, when drawn as {width, height}

    • pain

      public <T> int pain​(java.util.ArrayList<T> T)
      Bc T is just pain in the ass
      Parameters:
      T - Testosterone
      Returns:
      yes.

    • getOS

      public static java.lang.String getOS()
      fetches the OS the game is run on
      Returns:
      the OS currently booted

    • fetchAppdataFolder

      public static java.lang.String fetchAppdataFolder()
      returns the appdata folder of the running os
      Returns:
      the appdata folders location

    • fetchAppdataFolder

      public static java.lang.String fetchAppdataFolder​(java.lang.String os)
      Fetches the appdata folder from the given os
      Parameters:
      os - the operating system, the program is running on
      Returns:
      the path for appdata

    • loadFontFromAssets

      public static java.awt.Font loadFontFromAssets​(java.lang.String name)
      loads a font from the assets/fonts folder
      Parameters:
      name - the font name to load
      Returns:
      the newly created font

    • loadAllFonts

      public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.awt.Font> loadAllFonts()
      Loads all fonts from the assets folder as java.awt.Font This is needed as Greenfoot sucks and one requies a huge script using awt fonts to center some text
      Returns:
      an hashmap of fonts as name -> font

    • readImage

      public static void readImage​(java.io.File file) throws java.io.IOException
      reads an image from a file
      Parameters:
      file - the file to read the image from
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - thrown when an IOException occurs in ImageIO.read()

    • getKey

      public static java.lang.Object getKey​(java.util.Map m, java.lang.Object value)
      returns the first match of the value, in the map
      Parameters:
      m - the map to search in
      value - the value to search for
      Returns:
      key of the first occurrence of the value

    • readFromAssets

      public static java.lang.String readFromAssets​(java.lang.String filename)
      reads a file from the assets. this works in both, folder and jar structures.
      Parameters:
      filename - the file to read.
      Returns:
      the string inside of that file.

    • extract

      public static java.io.File extract​(java.lang.String source, java.lang.String to)
      extracts an package from the jar if in jar
      Parameters:
      source - the package to extract
      to - where to extract it
      Returns:
      the location as file of the extracted package/file. returns the original location when not loaded from jar

    • extractFile

      public static java.io.File extractFile​(java.lang.String sourceFile, java.lang.String to)
      This method is responsible for extracting resource files from within the .jar to the temporary directory.
      Parameters:
      sourceFile - The filepath relative to the 'Resources/' directory within the .jar from which to extract the file.
      Returns:
      A file object to the extracted file

    • attemptJar

      public static void attemptJar()
      checks if loaded from an jar file. Extracts the assets if loaded from jar.

    • removeExt

      public static java.lang.String removeExt​(java.lang.String s)
      Removes the file extension of a string
      Parameters:
      s - the filename with extension
      Returns:
      the filename without extension
